Description: Sets the name of the server as shown on the server list
Name that the server uses in-game (for example, for chat messages)
Sets the password for clients to connect to the server. Default is no password (blank)

Sets the password that clients of the [admin interface](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/admin_network.md) need to use it. Default is no password (blank), meaning the admin interface is disabled
Sets the time interval between automatic game saves
If set, the server will autosave on exit
Sets the savename of a game to load on server start. Both saved games and scenarios can be loaded. If no game savename is specified or the specified savename cannot be found, a new game is started
Sets the random seed for creating a new game
Maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time
Sets the minimum number of active players, below which the server will be automatically paused
Sets the maximum number of companies on the server
Enables admin chat on the server
Sets the currency for the server. If Custom is selected, the Custom Server Currency must also be set
Sets a custom currency for the server, if "Custom" is selected under Server Currency
Sets the number of AI competitors to be created on the server
Sets the quantity of towns created on a new map. If "Custom" is selected, Custom Town Quantity must also be set
If "Custom" is selected for Town Quantity, sets the exact number of towns to be created on a new map
Sets how many industries should be generated and what level should be maintained during the game

Sets the maximum initial amount a company can loan (in GBP), in multiples of Â£50,000. If the Server Currency is different, the amount will be converted at the relevant exchange rate. The maximum loan amount will increase over time if Inflation is enabled
Sets the initial interest rate charged on loans for a new map
Sets the level of maintenance and running costs of vehicles and infrastructure
Sets the speed at which the AI competitors will build (assuming AI competitors are not disabled)
Sets the frequency at which inadequately serviced vehicles break down
Sets the number of years for which subsidies are awarded. 0 = subsidies disabled
Sets the bonus multiplier for subsidies offered in-game (assuming they are not disabled)
Sets the level of construction and purchase costs
Sets the terrain type (hilliness of the landscape) for generating a new map
Sets the sea level, and as a result the size of the area covered by seas and lakes on a new map. If "Custom" is selected, Custom Sea Level must also be set
If "Custom" is selected for Sea Level, sets roughly the percentage area covered by seas and lakes on a new map
If enabled, economic recessions can occur on new maps every few years. During recessions, all production is significantly lower
If enabled, trains can reverse at the end of line only, and not at non-terminus stations, even if there is a shorter path to their next destination when reversing
If enabled, disasters can occur on a new map, which may occasionally block or destroy vehicles or infrastructure

Sets the council's attitude toward area restructuring in the game. The less tolerant the council, the faster player ratings will fall due to town asset demolition. The ratings will improve over time by effectively moving freight, mail and people to and from stations in the town's area of control. Players rated poor or worse by the council cannot place stations or demolish town roads, bridges or buildings
Sets the layout for the road network of towns
If enabled, towns are allowed to build roads. Otherwise, players must build roads for a town to grow
Sets whether towns can be founded by players during the game and, if so, whether they will use the road layout used by other towns in the game, or can have a custom layout
If enabled, towns are allowed to build level crossings
Sets how much cargo is produced by houses in towns, relative to the overall town population
If disabled, there can be two airports in each town. If enabled, the number of airports is limited by the noise acceptance of the town, which depends on population, airport size and distance
If set, inflation will be enabled in the economy, where costs rise slightly faster than payments
If enabled, two or more industries of the same type can be built on land that comes under the jurisdiction of one town. Normally only one of each type is allowed
If enabled, companies can try to bribe local authorities to increase their rating. If noticed by an inspector, the company will not be able to act in the town for six months
If enabled, allows buying of exclusive transport rights in the area of a local authority. Opponents' stations (passenger and cargo) will not receive any cargo for a whole year
If enabled, allows companies to give money to towns to fund new houses
If enabled, allows companies to give money to towns to fund road reconstruction, in order to sabotage road-based services in the town
If enabled, allows transfer of money between companies
If enabled, allows buying and selling of company shares. Shares will only be available for companies reaching a certain age
Sets the minimum age of a company for others to be able to buy and sell shares from them
Sets the speed of town growth
Sets the proportion of towns that will grow to become cities. For example, if 4 is specified, 1 in 4 (25%) will become cities. 0 = disabled
Sets the average initial size of cities relative to towns
If enabled, towns will remove useless road elements during construction to clean up dead-ends
Sets how far in tiles an object has to be from a town centre before it comes under the local authority jurisdiction

DisplayName: Town Population Noise Level Increase - Permissive
Description: If Town Council Tolerance is permissive, then the town noise limit will increase from the default for every specified number of inhabitants

DisplayName: Town Population Noise Level Increase - Tolerant
Description: If Town Council Tolerance is tolerant, then the town noise limit will increase from the default for every specified number of inhabitants

DisplayName: Town Population Noise Level Increase - Hostile
Description: If Town Council Tolerance is hostile, then the town noise limit will increase from the default for every specified number of inhabitants
If enabled, infrastructure causes maintenance costs. The cost grows in proportion to the network size, thus affecting larger companie more than smaller ones
If set, and vehicle breakdowns are disabled, vehicles will not go to depots or hangars for servicing

If set, only one vehicle is loaded at a time until full, before loading the next vehicle. When disabled, all vehicles in a station are loaded simultaineously, possibly needlessly blocking multiple platforms
If set, cargo will only be generated at a station when a vehicle with the capacity to pick that cargo up has visited. Affects station ratings
If enabled, a helicopter landing on a heliport or helipad will automatically be serviced
If set, vehicles will load cargo over a period of time, not full load instantly
If set, each airport type will stay available forever after its introduction
Sets the maximum area that parts of a station may be spread out over. High values will slow the game

If enabled, catchment areas will be differently sized for different types of stations and airports, and as a result be more realistic. For example, train stations have a larger catchment area than bus stations and airport catchment areas are bigger still
If enabled, industries with attached stations may also be served by company-owned stations built nearby. Otherwise, they can only be served by their own attached stations
If enabled, allows building a station directly adjacent to another one to create a new station instead of merging the new tile(s) with the existing station
If enabled, players building a new station have the option of merging it with an existing station within the catchment area or creating a new station
Sets which side of the road vehicles drive on
Sets the physics model for train acceleration. "Original" penalises slopes equally for all vehicles. "Realistic" penalises slopes depending on various properties, like length and tractive effort

Sets the physics model for road vehicle acceleration. "Original" penalises slopes equally for all vehicles. "Realistic" penalises slopes depending on various properties of the engine, like tractive effort
Sets the steepness of slopes for trains. Higher values make it more difficult to climb a hill. It only applies if the Realistic acceleration model is selected
Sets the steepness of slopes for road vehicles. Higher values make it more difficult to climb a hill. It only applies if the Realistic acceleration model is selected
Sets the maximum length of a train
If set, each vehicle model will stay available forever after its introduction
Sets the maximum number of trains that a company can have
Sets the maximum number of road vehicles that a company can have
Sets the maximum number of aircraft that a company can have
Sets the maximum number of ships that a company can have
If enabled, the speed limits of wagons (if any) are also used to determine the maximum speed of a train
If set, tracks will not be required to be electrified to enable electric engines to run on them
Sets the impact of carrying freight in trains. The weight of freight trains is multiplied by this multiplier to simulate very heavy trains for more realism
Sets the relative speed of aircraft compared to other vehicle types, to reduce the amount of income of transport by aircraft
If enabled, multiple NewGRF vehicle sets will be able to exist side-by-side
Sets the probability of aircraft crashes
Extends every vehicle's life by the number of years specified
If enabled, servicing of vehicles will be triggered by reliability dropping to a certain percentage of the maximum reliability, rather than by the time passed since the last service
Sets the default service interval for new trains, if no explicit service interval is set for the vehicle. Increment by 15 from minimum 30
Sets the default service interval for new road vehicles, if no explicit service interval is set for the vehicle. Increment by 15 from minimum 30
Sets the default service interval for new ships, if no explicit service interval is set for the vehicle. Increment by 15 from minimum 30
Sets the default service interval for new aircraft, if no explicit service interval is set for the vehicle. Increment by 15 from minimum 40
Sets the nationality that town names are sourced from in randomly generated games. If Other is selected, Custom Town Name Nationality must also be set
Sets a custom NewGRF source for random town names, if "Other" is selected under Town Name Nationality. The NewGRF file must be installed in the newgrf directory
Sets the landscape for the server, which determines basic gameplay scenarios with different cargos and town growth requirements
Sets max map height
This setting allows you to determine at what altitude snow will appear
Sets the starting year for the game
The value set to this parameter represents the year the server will restart
Year the game will end
This specifies the land generation system that you use, either the Original or Terra Genesis Perlin (TGP)
This option determines the maximum allowed distance (in tiles) from the edge of the map for an Oil Refinery
Sets the smoothness
This sets the variety of distribution
Sets how trees are distributed on the map. Original = uniformly scattered. Improved = planted in groups
The Map size determines the size and shape of your map
The Map size determines the size and shape of your map
Bitset of the borders that are water by creating an new game
sets minimum river length
Sets total amount of rivers
Sets the server branch to install. NOTE: Update the server after switching branches!
